intro: Lactuca glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular lettuce, is a species of flowering plant in the dandelion family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, white seed heads. It contains a milky sap, which is typical of the genus Lactuca. This species is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
